result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josue Emanuel Melendez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Josue Emanuel Melendez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Josue Emanuel Melendez.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected plea and sentencing date. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Josue Emanuel Melendez.  Attorney John J Rejowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Josue Emanuel Melendez not in court, in custody.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Josue Emanuel Melendez in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Josue Emanuel Melendez in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Josue Emanuel Melendez appeared by video means. 
Case in court for plea hearing. Defense counsel informs the Court that Defendant no longer wishes to accept the offer and that Defendant wishes to have new representation. Defense counsel requests withdraw as counsel. Court grants Defense's request to withdraw. 
Case set for status of counsel. Case remains calendared in Br 4.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Josue Emanuel Melendez not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Discovery and offer received. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Josue Emanuel Melendez not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued, State objects to modification of bail. Court denies defense's bail motion. Case is adjourned in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (18 pages) commencing 04-27-2022 by GEORGENE LITTLEFAIR.

03:52 PM Defendant Josue E Melendez in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Josue E Melendez in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective A. Fitzgerald. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Josue E Melendez not in court, defendant in custody.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Incorrect - Defendant to have no contact with himself? Possible incorrect submission re: co-actor?

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
no contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Trevon Galmore (co-defendant), Marco X L-G, Jasirey Q, Alfredo G (occupants of the Honda).

Defendant Josue E Melendez in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Josue E Melendez in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Josue E Melendez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
